name: XVerExtensionSubscriptionTopic.canFilterBy
title: Cross-Version Extension for FHIR R5:SubscriptionTopic.canFilterBy compared to FHIR R4
description: SubscriptionTopic.canFilterBy does not exist in target and has no mapping

element.short: Properties by which a Subscription can filter notifications from the SubscriptionTopic
element.definition: List of properties by which Subscriptions on the SubscriptionTopic can be filtered. May be defined Search Parameters (e.g., Encounter.patient) or parameters defined within this SubscriptionTopic context (e.g., hub.event).
element.comment: SubscriptionTopic.canFilterBy does not exist in target and has no mapping

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Description of how this filtering parameter is intended to be used.

element.short: URL of the triggering Resource that this filter applies to
element.definition: URL of the Resource that is the type used in this filter. This is the "focus" of the topic (or one of them if there are more than one). It will be the same, a generality, or a specificity of SubscriptionTopic.resourceTrigger.resource or SubscriptionTopic.eventTrigger.resource when they are present.
element.comment: URL of the Resource that is the type used in this filter. Relative URLs are relative to the StructureDefinition root of the implemented FHIR version (e.g., http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition). For example, "Patient" maps to http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Patient. For more information, see ElementDefinition.type.code.

element.short: Human-readable and computation-friendly name for a filter parameter usable by subscriptions on this topic, via Subscription.filterBy.filterParameter
element.definition: Either the canonical URL to a search parameter (like "http://hl7.org/fhir/SearchParameter/encounter-patient") or topic-defined parameter (like "hub.event") which is a label for the filter.
element.comment: Chained parameters are allowed (like "patient.gender") - but can not use colons or modifiers.

element.short: Canonical URL for a filterParameter definition
element.definition: Either the canonical URL to a search parameter (like "http://hl7.org/fhir/SearchParameter/encounter-patient") or the officially-defined URI for a shared filter concept (like "http://example.org/concepts/shared-common-event").
element.comment: Chained parameters are allowed (like "patient.gender") - but can not use colons or modifiers.

element.short: eq | ne | gt | lt | ge | le | sa | eb | ap
element.definition: Comparators allowed for the filter parameter.
element.comment: If no comparators are listed, clients should not expect servers to support any comparators.

element.short: missing | exact | contains | not | text | in | not-in | below | above | type | identifier | of-type | code-text | text-advanced | iterate
element.definition: Modifiers allowed for the filter parameter.
element.comment: If no modifiers are listed, clients should not expect servers to support any modifiers.

element.short: Properties by which a Subscription can filter notifications from the SubscriptionTopic
element.definition: List of properties by which Subscriptions on the SubscriptionTopic can be filtered. May be defined Search Parameters (e.g., Encounter.patient) or parameters defined within this SubscriptionTopic context (e.g., hub.event).
element.comment: SubscriptionTopic.canFilterBy does not exist in target and has no mapping
